Anti-Trans Bills Signed Into Law This Year

🔗: https://www.tiktok.com/t/ZTRWhr4TC/

With literally hundreds of anti-LGBTQ+ bills advancing through state legislatures, let’s take a look at 7 already signed into LAW.

In Utah there’s SB 16, which bans life-saving gender affirming healthcare for children. Utah also has SB 100, which forcibly outs children as transgender or non-binary to their parents, even if they’re abusive bigots. These are both state laws in Utah as of the last two months.

In Tennessee, there’s SB 3, a drag ban that is written so broadly it can be used to charge a transgender person with a felony for just standing outside. They also have SB 1, one of the most aggressive bans against life-saving gender affirming healthcare for children. These are both state laws in Tennessee as of yesterday.

South Dakota has HB 1080 and Mississippi has HB 1125. Both also ban life-saving gender affirming healthcare for children. This has been state law in South Dakota and Mississippi since only last month.

Finally there’s Arkansas with SB 43, which has a slightly happy ending. It was supposed to be a drag ban that would have also impacted transgender people-- but the bill was gutted and all references to drag were thankfully removed. The law in place does not specifically target LGBTQ+ people anymore, causing celebration among local advocates.

Remember that these bills CAN be defeated and hey CAN be overturned. Out of the 378 anti-LGBTQ bills proposed, 7 were signed into law and 39 were defeated. However, there are 13 that were just recently introduced and 319 bills that are ADVANCING in their state legislatures. Keep fighting against the right-wing war against LGBTQ+ existence.

title: On the inconsistency of separable losses for structured prediction

last_post.content:
Structured prediction is computationally hard because the log-sum-exp cannot be decomposed into a sum of smaller components. Hence many practical approaches assume a model that separates into individual sums. But this paper shows that this separation means that the model is no longer Bayes consistent. But why does structured prediction work well in practice?
#MachineLearning #NaturalLanguageProcessing

This would violate: 52 U.S.C. § 30118 (illegal corporate contributions) https://www.law.cornell.edu/uscode/text/52/30118
